y call
“the program“; the symbols I give back to them they call “answers to the
questions” and me they call “the computer.” Suppose that after a while the
programmers get so good at writing the programs and I get so good at ma-
nipulating the symbols that my answers are indistinguishable from those of
native Chinese speakers. I can pass the Turing test for understanding Chi-
nese. But all the same I still don’t understand a word of Chinese and neither
does any other digital computer because all
